title: Ring isomorphism between polynomial matrices and polynomials over matrices
content:
The main result of this section is theorem ~ pmmpric , which shows that the ring of polynomial matrices and the ring of polynomials having matrices as coefficients (called "polynomials over matrices" in the following) are isomorphic:
` ( Poly1 `` ( N Mat R ) ) ~= ( N Mat ( Poly1 `` R ) ) `

Or in a more common notation:
` ( N Mat ( Poly1 `` R ) ) ` corresponds to M(n, R[[t]), the ring of n x n polynomial matrices over the ring R.
` ( Poly1 `` ( N Mat R ) ) ` corresponds to M(n, R)[[t], the polynomial ring over the ring of n x n matrices with entries in ring R.

` T = ( m e. B |-> ( Q gsum ( k e. NN0 |-> ( ( m decompPMat k ) .* ( k .^ X ) ) ) ) ) `

with ` B = ( Base `` ( N Mat ( Poly1 `` R ) ) ) ` and ` ( m decompPMat k ) = ( i e. N , j e. N |-> ( ( coe1 ` ( i m j ) ) ` k ) ) ) ` is an isomorphism between these rings:

` T : B -1-1-onto-> L ` with ` L = ( Base `` ( Poly1 `` ( N Mat R ) ) ) ` (see ~ pm2mpf1o and ~ pm2mprngiso ), and

` I = ( p e. L |-> ( i e. N , j e. N |-> ( P gsum ( k e. NN0 |-> ( ( i ( ( coe1 ` p ) ` k ) j ) .x. ( k E Y ) ) ) ) ) ) `

is the corresponding inverse function:

` ( T `` ( I `` O ) ) = O ) ` (see ~ mp2pm2mp ).

In this section, the following conventions are mostly used:
  • ` R ` is a (unital) ring (see ~ df-ring )
  • ` P = ( Poly1 `` R ) ` is the polynomial algebra over (the ring) ` R ` (see ~ df-ply1 )
    • ` K = ( Base `` P ) ` is its base set (see ~ df-base )
    • ` Y = ( var1 `` R ) ` is its variable (see ~ df-vr1 )
    • ` .x. = ( .s `` P ) ` is its scalar multiplication (see ~ df-vsca or ~ lmodvscl )
    • ` E = ( .g `` ( mulGrp `` P ) ) ` is its exponentiation (see ~ df-mulg )
  • ` A = ( N Mat R ) ` is the algebra of N x N matrices over (the ring) ` R ` (see ~ df-mat )
  • ` C = ( N Mat P ) ` is the algebra of N x N matrices over (the polynomial ring) ` P `.
    • ` B = ( Base `` C ) ` is its base set
    • ` M e. B ` is a concrete polynomial matrix
  • ` Q = ( Poly1 `` A ) ` is the polynomial algebra over (the matrix ring) ` A `.
    • ` L = ( Base `` Q ) ` is its base set
    • ` O e. L ` is a concrete polynomial with matrix coefficients
    • ` X = ( var1 `` A ) ` is its variable
    • ` .* = ( .s `` Q ) ` is its scalar multiplication
    • ` .^ = ( .g `` ( mulGrp `` Q ) ) ` is its exponentiation

}

blocks.name: mptcoe1matfsupp
blocks.content: The mapping extracting the entries of the coefficient matrices of a polynomial over matrices at a fixed position is finitely supported. (Contributed by AV, 6-Oct-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: pm2mpgrpiso
blocks.content: The transformation of polynomial matrices into polynomials over matrices is an additive group isomorphism. (Contributed by AV, 17-Oct-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm pm2mpgrpiso(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c2, co(c3, cgim, c4)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cpl1, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c0, cmat, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cvsca, c4))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cmg, cfv(cmgp, c4)))
  -| wceq(c9, cfv(cv1, c10))
  -| wceq(c10, co(c0, cmat, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cpl1, c10))
  -| wceq(c11, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c0, cpm2mp, c1))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c2, co(c3, cgim, c4)), wcel(c2, co(c3, cghm, c4)), wf1o(c2, c6, cfv(cbs, c4)))
  pm2mpghm(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, c8, c9, c10, c11)
  pm2mpf1o(c0, c1, c2, c6, cfv(cbs, c4), c5, c3, c7, c4, c8, c9, c10)
  isgim(c2, c3, c4, c6, cfv(cbs, c4))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c4))
}

blocks.name: pm2mpmhm
blocks.content: The transformation of polynomial matrices into polynomials over matrices is a homomorphism of multiplicative monoids. (Contributed by AV, 22-Oct-2019.) (Revised by AV, 6-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm pm2mpmhm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c2, co(cfv(cmgp, c3), cmhm, cfv(cmgp, c4))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cpl1, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c0, cmat, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c0, cmat, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cpl1, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c0, cpm2mp, c1))
} = {
  syl21anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c2, co(cfv(cmgp, c3), cmhm, cfv(cmgp, c4))), wcel(cfv(cmgp, c3), cmnd), wcel(cfv(cmgp, c4), cmnd), w3a(wf(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c4))), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), wceq(cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(cmulr, c4), cfv(c2, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(cur, c3)), cfv(cur, c4))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cfv(cmgp, c3), cmnd), wcel(c3, crg))
  pmatring(c0, c1, c3, c5)
  ringmgp(c3, cfv(cmgp, c3))
  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(cfv(cmgp, c4), cmnd), wcel(c6, crg), wcel(c4, crg))
  matring(c0, c1, c6)
  ply1ring(c6, c4)
  ringmgp(c4, cfv(cmgp, c4))
  3jca(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wf(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c4))), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), wceq(cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c3), cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(cmulr, c4), cfv(c2, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(cur, c3)), cfv(cur, c4)))
  pm2mpf(c0, c1, c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c4)), c5, c3, cfv(cvsca, c4), c4, cfv(cmg, cfv(cmgp, c4)), cfv(cv1, c6), c6)
  eqcomi(cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c4)), cfv(cbs, c4))
  mgpbas(cfv(cbs, c4), cfv(cmgp, c4), c4)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c4))
  pm2mpmhmlem2(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), c2, c3, c4, c5, c6)
  eqcomi(cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), cfv(cbs, c3))
  mgpbas(cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(cmgp, c3), c3)
  idpm2idmp(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(cvsca, c4), cfv(cmg, cfv(cmgp, c4)), cfv(cv1, c6), c6)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c3))
  eqid(cfv(cvsca, c4))
  eqid(cfv(cmg, cfv(cmgp, c4)))
  eqid(cfv(cv1, c6))
  ismhm(hs0, hs1, c2, cfv(cmgp, c3), cfv(cmgp, c4), cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c4)), cfv(cmulr, c3), cfv(cmulr, c4), cfv(cur, c3), cfv(cur, c4))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c4)))
  mgpplusg(cfv(cmulr, c3), cfv(cmgp, c3), c3)
  eqid(cfv(cmulr, c3))
  mgpplusg(cfv(cmulr, c4), cfv(cmgp, c4), c4)
  eqid(cfv(cmulr, c4))
  ringidval(cfv(cur, c3), cfv(cmgp, c3), c3)
  eqid(cfv(cmgp, c3))
  eqid(cfv(cur, c3))
  ringidval(cfv(cur, c4), cfv(cmgp, c4), c4)
  eqid(cfv(cmgp, c4))
  eqid(cfv(cur, c4))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cbs, cfv(cmgp, c3)))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cmgp, c3))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cmgp, c4))
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cmgp, c3))
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cmgp, c4))
}

thm pm2mpmhm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring)‚Üí c2 ‚àà((mulGrp ` c3)[MndHom](mulGrp ` c4)))
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Poly1 ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(c0[Mat]c5)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(c0[Mat]c1)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Poly1 ` c6)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(c0[pMatToMatPoly]c1)
} = {
  syl21anbrc((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring), c2 ‚àà((mulGrp ` c3)[MndHom](mulGrp ` c4)), (mulGrp ` c3)‚àà Mnd, (mulGrp ` c4)‚àà Mnd, ((c2 :(Base `(mulGrp ` c3))‚Üí(Base `(mulGrp ` c4)))‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(Base `(mulGrp ` c3)), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà(Base `(mulGrp ` c3)),(c2 `(hs0[(√ó ` c3)]hs1))=((c2 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)](c2 ` hs1))))‚àß(c2 `(1r ` c3))=(1r ` c4)))
  syl((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring), (mulGrp ` c3)‚àà Mnd, c3 ‚àà Ring)
  pmatring(c0, c1, c3, c5)
  ringmgp(c3, (mulGrp ` c3))
  3syl((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring), (mulGrp ` c4)‚àà Mnd, c6 ‚àà Ring, c4 ‚àà Ring)
  matring(c0, c1, c6)
  ply1ring(c6, c4)
  ringmgp(c4, (mulGrp ` c4))
  3jca((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Ring), (c2 :(Base `(mulGrp ` c3))‚Üí(Base `(mulGrp ` c4))), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(Base `(mulGrp ` c3)), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà(Base `(mulGrp ` c3)),(c2 `(hs0[(√ó ` c3)]hs1))=((c2 ` hs0)[(√ó ` c4)](c2 ` hs1)))), (c2 `(1r ` c3))=(1r ` c4))
  pm2mpf(c0, c1, c2, (Base `(mulGrp ` c3)), (Base `(mulGrp ` c4)), c5, c3, (√ó ` c4), c4, (.g `(mulGrp ` c4)), (var1 ` c6), c6)
  eqcomi((Base `(mulGrp ` c4)), (Base ` c4))
  mgpbas((Base ` c4), (mulGrp ` c4), c4)
  eqid((Base ` c4))
  pm2mpmhmlem2(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, (Base `(mulGrp ` c3)), c2, c3, c4, c5, c6)
  eqcomi((Base `(mulGrp ` c3)), (Base ` c3))
  mgpbas((Base ` c3), (mulGrp ` c3), c3)
  idpm2idmp(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, (Base ` c3), (√ó ` c4), (.g `(mulGrp ` c4)), (var1 ` c6), c6)
  eqid((Base ` c3))
  eqid((√ó ` c4))
  eqid((.g `(mulGrp ` c4)))
  eqid((var1 ` c6))
  ismhm(hs0, hs1, c2, (mulGrp ` c3), (mulGrp ` c4), (Base `(mulGrp ` c3)), (Base `(mulGrp ` c4)), (√ó ` c3), (√ó ` c4), (1r ` c3), (1r ` c4))
  eqid((Base `(mulGrp ` c3)))

blocks.name: pm2mprhm
blocks.content: The transformation of polynomial matrices into polynomials over matrices is a ring homomorphism. (Contributed by AV, 22-Oct-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm pm2mprhm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c2, co(c3, crh, c4)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cpl1, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c0, cmat, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c0, cmat, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cpl1, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c0, cpm2mp, c1))
} = {
  syl21anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c2, co(c3, crh, c4)), wcel(c3, crg), wcel(c4, crg), wa(wcel(c2, co(c3, cghm, c4)), wcel(c2, co(cfv(cmgp, c3), cmhm, cfv(cmgp, c4)))))
  pmatring(c0, c1, c3, c5)
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c4, crg), wcel(c6, crg))
  matring(c0, c1, c6)
  ply1ring(c6, c4)
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)), wcel(c2, co(c3, cghm, c4)), wcel(c2, co(cfv(cmgp, c3), cmhm, cfv(cmgp, c4))))
  pm2mpghm(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(cvsca, c4), cfv(cmg, cfv(cmgp, c4)), cfv(cv1, c6), c6, cfv(cbs, c4))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c3))
  eqid(cfv(cvsca, c4))
  eqid(cfv(cmg, cfv(cmgp, c4)))
  eqid(cfv(cv1, c6))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c4))
  pm2mpmhm(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6)
  isrhm(c2, c3, c4, cfv(cmgp, c3), cfv(cmgp, c4))
  eqid(cfv(cmgp, c3))
  eqid(cfv(cmgp, c4))

blocks.name: pmmpric
blocks.content: The ring of polynomial matrices over a ring is isomorphic to the ring of polynomials over matrices of the same dimension over the same ring. (Contributed by AV, 30-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: monmat2matmon
